data.title: Contact us
data.meta_description: Links and contact details for UNHCR to help refugees, displaced or stateless persons, as well as UNHCR donors, find the information they are looking for.
data.text:
Hi, if you are a refugee, asylum-seeker, displaced or stateless person in need of help or services from UNHCR, please see our dedicated HELP site.

On the HELP site, will find information on how to contact the local office in your country or context as well as country-specific information on seeking asylum, legal assistance and other services and advice.

Go to the HELP site

Hi, we have a dedicated website set up for refugees seeking to pursue higher education. View the Opportunities for refugees site to browse scholarship opportunities and accredited higher education programmes verified by UNHCR.

Best of luck with your studies.

View the Opportunities for refugees site

Thank you for your interest in working with us.

We are always on the lookout for talented, motivated and passionate staff. Please visit our Careers page for more information on what we look for, current vacancies and how to apply.

We also regularly recruit interns, providing eligible students and recent graduates the opportunity to gain experience in the humanitarian sector. See our Internships page for more information.

Work with us

Intern with us

Firstly, thank you so much for your incredible support. Your generosity means UNHCR can be there for people forced to flee conflict and persecution.

If you have a question regarding your donation, such as how to change or cancel your donation, receive a tax receipt or other inquiries or feedback, please use this contact form to get in touch with our donor care team.

They will get back to you as soon as they can.

Contact the UNHCR donor care team

Thank you for considering partnering with or donating to us. Our dedicated private sector partners team would love to hear from you.

Please visit our Private sector partnerships page for more information and their contact details.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Visit the Private sector partnerships page

If you’re a journalist or member of the media, you can find contact details for spokespersons on our Media centre page, along with links to our latest press releases and statements, high-quality photo and video packages, and the most recent UNHCR data on forced displacement.

Thank you for your interest in covering the plight of people forced to flee and UNHCR’s work to protect and advocate for them globally.

UNHCR Media centre

Prospective vendors or contractors who wish to contest their non-selection for a UNHCR project or ask for a debrief about a procurement process that concerns them can contact the UNHCR Supply management service.

Please see our Procurement debriefs and protests page for instructions and contact details.

Procurement debriefs and protests page

If you have reason to believe that a staff member or another person associated with UNHCR or an entity with a contractual relationship with UNHCR has not behaved correctly, you can report an allegation of misconduct by contacting the Inspector General’s Office.

Thank you for taking the time to report potential misconduct. By doing so you help keep people safe and ensure resources are used appropriately.

Online complaint form

Hi, thank you for taking the time to contact us about this issue. You are helping keep other people safe from fraud and scams by doing so.

If you have seen a website, email, social media post, or another piece of digital communication, that you believe is fraudulently representing UNHCR, we would be grateful if you would report it to us.

Report a fraudulent site or social media

We are sorry you couldn’t find what you were looking for in the options above.

Please use this Contact form to get in touch with UNHCR and we’ll aim to direct your query, question, concern or feedback to the correct team.

Contact form
